title: Go Skateboarding
name: Go Skateboarding
description:
A Map by Hive

Don't let anyone stop you.  Add your favorite gaps, ledges, banks, hills, curbs, handrails, ramps, cuts, or anywhere else you find you self skating. Don't forget to add photos.  Also, if you have gnarly slam stories, add them to this map http://platial.com/hive/map/1921#Gnarly_Skateboard_Injuries

properties.name: Lloyd Plaza
properties.description: Posted by Matthartskates This is a mad street plaza with loads of things to skate. Its got: -Ledges (all sizes) -Gaps -Stairs(from 4 to big 2 to 10 to 4 flat gap) -Drops -Rails -Parking blocks that are slanted to jump off of -Hubbas -Manual Pads -Ledges to gaps -Stairs To gaps -Drops to gaps -Everything is pre waxed - And More You rarely get kicked out and on sundays you never get kicked out most of it is under cover so you can skate it in the rain if your farely close close to lloyd center mall and nearby fast food

properties.name: Skatepark of Tampa Pro 2006 Finals - video
properties.description: Posted by Jason  Here it is ... Finals footage from this year\'s Tampa Pro Contest at the Skatepark Of Tampa. The park is amazing and seeing these guys ripping all day is a damn treat. Everyone was pulling crazy tricks, so I don\'t know how the judges decided the top five. In the end, Lutzka came out on top with a prize of 0k, followed by Jereme Rogers (,500) and Kyle Berard (,000). Sheckler would probably have been in the top three, but he took a nasty slam to the head trying to kickflip back-lip the big rail. He still came back, however, and landed the trick in the final run. If you\'ve never been down to Tampa, you should try to make it down next year. It\'s a damn good time. Thanks to Ryan Clements for the media passes. Featured skaters: Corey Duffel, Clint Peterson, Kyle Berard, Austen Seaholm, Ryan Sheckler, Greg Lutzka, Pat Channita, Jereme Rogers, Dennis Busenitz, Rodney Jones, Billy Marks, Nilton Neeves. Visit www.GetRadSkate.com for more skate footage!

properties.name: Start - The Mt. Tabor to Waterfront Skaterace
properties.description: Posted by JakeTop o\' Mt. TaborMeet at the top of Mt. Tabor at 9:00AM for this kickoff event. The route will go down Mt.Tabor to 60th Ave and then continue down SE Hawthorne from 60th to the Eastside Waterfront. Signs will mark the way to the starting point and then just follow the mob down. You can take this race as seriously as you\'d like to show you\'re one of the fastest shredders in Portland, or just show up as a participant in an event that will definitely stop traffic and make a statement to everyone on the street. We want to get as many people out to do this as possible. (Some suggestions for the race: Carpool/ride the bus to the starting point so you don\'t have to leave your car at Mt. Tabor. Try and show up as close to 9:00am as possible so that you don\'t get left behind the group. If possible, line up 2 cars: one to leave down near Eastside Waterfront and take one up to Tabor. After the race, cruise back up and retrieve that car. You\'ll work it out.

properties.name: Stoke Plaza Skatepark
properties.description: Posted by Jason  chell st, stoke on trent, uk\'STOKEPLAZA\' is, arguably, the largest and most original skateplaza\'s in Europe (34000 square feet!), here in Stoke-on-Trent!!!! Around £500,000 has been put forward, by Stoke-on-Trent City Council (with the financial support from Sport England, Staffordshire Environmental Fund, Advantage West Midlands, Government Office for the West Midlands), to match the dreams and aspirations of the SAS, to have a skate facility to be proud of and put the city on the map! To add to the plaza, the first pieces of \'skateable\' areas that were built at CFP, were the \'SKATEPATHS\'. These are \'off-shoots\', off the main pathways, through Central Forest Park and are situated near the plaza area. They feature various street skating architecture that do\'nt feature in the plaza.

properties.name: The Legendary Burnside Skatepark
properties.description: Posted by Jason  under the east side of the Burnside Bridge, Portland, ORThe model for DIY Guerrilla skatepark making! Still running strong, this park is here because of the dedication of all the people who pitched in with shovels, trash cans, beer, and just pure gnarly skateboarding. Here\'s a video i found on youtube, it\'s got great skating and it cpatures exactly the experince of just hanging out at the park, highlights, slams, cops, fights, animals, attitude, profanity and amazement.

properties.name: VOLCOM WILD IN THE PARKS CONTEST THIS SATURDAY AUG. 19TH!!
properties.description: Posted by Jake 15 Ne Hancock St, Portland, ORIn case you hadn\'t heard, The Dept. is hosting the Volcom Wild in the Parks Am Contest this Saturday August 19th. The contest is free to enter and has 2 divisions: 14 yrs. and under and 15 yrs. and over. The contest is a jam style format and should get started around noon. Registrations begins at 11:00am or you can pre-register on Volcom\'s website volcom.com. There will be prizes and giveaways, and free hotdogs until they\'re gone so make sure to come through early. THE DEPT. WILL NOT BE HAVING THE 10:00AM SESSION THIS SATURDAY BECAUSE OF THE CONTEST. WE APOLOGIZE FOR ANY INCONVENIENCE THIS MAY CAUSE. WE WILL RETURN TO NORMAL SESSION SCHEDULE FOLLOWING THE CONTEST. We definitely encourage everyone to come and enter. Entry is free so what do you have to lose?

properties.name: Vancouver Skatepark - The Pit
properties.description: Posted by Jason   Not terrible, but not great. Gets crowded, hard to get any real lines going. On the location of a legendary oldschool skatespot called The Pit.

properties.name: Venice United Methodist Church
properties.description: Posted by Fivefingers Venice UMCVenice United Methodist church celebrates worship on Sundays at 10:30 a.m. Services are between 60 and 75 minutes long. Following the service, everyone is invited to share a bit of refreshment during our “hospitality” time in the parlor, before they carry on with their day. Come ride the free Venice United Methodist Church Mini Ramp. The ramp is 23 ft wide and 6 ft with 8 & 9 ft (2 ft wide) extensions, Skate-lite surface with steel coping and night-time lighting. Open till 9 pm.

properties.name: Western Banks
properties.description: Posted by Baostar Western Ave, Stanton, CAMike and Donnie at a bank near Western Ave. and Industrial Way in Stanton, California (circa 1990). The area is in "the heart of Crow Village" as Donnie stated, where the Crow Village Gang claims territory. The banks are very rough, steep, and hard to skate, but Mike got pretty good at it after several runs. No one really knows about the spot or skate there for that matter.
